availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Burton Parker (Hopkins County, Kentucky, miller, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, miller and farmer. Virginia Native. Married to Mary Jane Crabtree Parker in Christian County, Kentucky on July 18, 1841. Father of Emily Parker and Harriet Parker. Married to Martha A. Crabtree Parker in Christian County, Kentucky, on January 3, 1852. Father of William Henry Parker, Capatola Parker, and Jessie Parker. Miller in Christian County in 1850. Employed Emsley Henderson and Samuel Gamble as laborers in Christian County in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Hopkins County from 1857 to 1859. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

Journals of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. 35. University of Kentucky. https://uknowledge.uky.edu/kystatejournals/35.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 815.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 219B.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994031, Christian County Marriages, p. 208.
